content: Indonesian coral reefs face multiple threats, requiring innovative management strategies. A new study emphasizes the need to integrate various stressors into Marine Protected Area (MPA) management plans. This approach aims to enhance the resilience of coral reef ecosystems against climate change, pollution, and overfishing. By addressing these challenges holistically, Indonesia hopes to better protect its vital coral reefs and the communities that depend on them.
source_headline: Managing Indonesian coral reefs: Integration of stressors in Marine Protected Area (MPA) management plans - ScienceDirect.com
